refnamediv.refpurpose: A base class with input and output triggers, but no actual read or write methods. Those are left for derived classes to support.

refsect1.title: Description

refsect2.title: GskIOClass
refsect2.para: Methods which derived classes should overload to implement their polling and shutdown strategies.

listitem.simpara: The base class (private).
This is a signal which is emitted after a connection has been completed.
Open resources. This is called when the GskIO is constructed.
This function should turn on/off whether the implementation will call gsk_io_notify_ready_to_read().
This function should turn on/off whether the implementation will call gsk_io_notify_ready_to_write().
This function should stop the object from being readable ever again. If applicable, a user's read-trap's shutdown callback will be run.
This function should stop the object from being writable ever again. If applicable, a user's write-trap's shutdown callback will be run.
Deallocate system resources associated with instance.

refsect2.title: GskIO
refsect2.para: The base class for all input/output objects. It has no public members.

refsect2.title: GskIOHookFunc ()
refsect2.para: A callback which will be run when either the object is ready to read or write, or shutdown in either direction.

listitem.simpara: an object which is ready to read or write
the data passed to gsk_io_trap_readable() or gsk_io_trap_writable().
whether the trap should be kept, otherwise it will be deleted.

refsect2.title: enum GskIOErrorCause
refsect2.programlisting: typedef enum { GSK_IO_ERROR_NONE, GSK_IO_ERROR_INIT, GSK_IO_ERROR_CONNECT, GSK_IO_ERROR_OPEN, GSK_IO_ERROR_READ, GSK_IO_ERROR_WRITE, GSK_IO_ERROR_POLL_READ, GSK_IO_ERROR_POLL_WRITE, GSK_IO_ERROR_SHUTDOWN_READ, GSK_IO_ERROR_SHUTDOWN_WRITE, GSK_IO_ERROR_CLOSE, GSK_IO_ERROR_SYNC, GSK_IO_ERROR_POLL } GskIOErrorCause;
refsect2.para: Every GskIO has an GError and a GskIOErrorCause which tells the last error observed on the stream, and what type of action triggered it.
Implementations can use gsk_io_set_error() to register an error.

listitem.simpara: No error has been observed.
An error occurred opening the file.
An error occurred reading from the file.
An error occurred polling for readability.
An error occurred polling for writability.
An error occurred shutting down the read end.
An error occurred shutting down the write end.
An error occurred closing.

refsect2.title: GSK_IO_READ_HOOK()
refsect2.para: Get a pointer to the GskHook corresponding to the read end of the GskIO.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO which contains the read-hook.

refsect2.title: GSK_IO_WRITE_HOOK()
refsect2.para: Get a pointer to the GskHook corresponding to the write end of the GskIO.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO which contains the write-hook.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_block_read()
refsect2.para: Block the read hook from being triggered.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO whose read hook should be blocked.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_block_write()
refsect2.para: Block the write hook from being triggered.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO whose write hook should be blocked.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_unblock_read()
refsect2.para: Unblock the read hook from being triggered.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO whose read hook should be unblocked.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_unblock_write()
refsect2.para: Unblock the write hook from being triggered.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO whose write hook should be unblocked.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_has_read_hook()
refsect2.para: Return whether the read hook is trapped.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO whose read hook should be tested.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_has_write_hook()
refsect2.para: Return whether the write hook is trapped.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO whose write hook should be tested.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_trap_readable()
refsect2.para: Trap the read end of the GskIO.
Note that only one trap of a GskIO's read-end is allowed at a time.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO whose read end should be trapped.
the function to call (a GskIOHookFunc) when it's readable.
the function to call (a GskIOHookFunc) when it's read end is shut down.
data passed along to func and shutdown_func
optional function called when the hook is untrapped.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_trap_writable()
refsect2.para: Trap the write end of the GskIO.
Note that only one trap of a GskIO's write-end is allowed at a time.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO whose write end should be trapped.
the function to call (a GskIOHookFunc) when it's writable.
the function to call (a GskIOHookFunc) when it's write end is shut down.
data passed along to func and shutdown_func
optional function called when the hook is untrapped.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_untrap_readable()
refsect2.para: Untrap the read end of the GskIO.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO whose read end should be untrapped.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_untrap_writable()
refsect2.para: Untrap the write end of the GskIO.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO whose write end should be untrapped.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_shutdown ()
refsect2.para: Shutdown the read and write ends of a GskIO.

listitem.simpara: the object which should be shut down.
optional error to set upon failure.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_read_shutdown()
refsect2.para: Shutdown both the read ends of the GskIO.
Returns TRUE if the shutdown succeeded immediately.
Returns FALSE if the shutdown has been initiated but not finished, or if an error occurred. These cases can be distinguished by looking at the error return.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to affect.
error return if things go wrong.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_write_shutdown()
refsect2.para: Shutdown both the write ends of the GskIO.
Returns FALSE if the shutdown has been initiated but not finished, or if an error occurred. These cases can be distinguished by looking at the error return.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to affect.
optional error return if things go wrong.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_close ()
refsect2.para: Close an open GskIO.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to close.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_notify_ready_to_read()
refsect2.para: Trigger an is-readable event. This should only be called by derived implementations.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO whose read-end is ready.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_notify_ready_to_write()
refsect2.para: Trigger an is-writable event. This should only be called by derived implementations.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO whose write-end is ready.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_notify_read_shutdown()
refsect2.para: Trigger a read-end-shutdown event. This should only be called by derived implementations.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO whose read-end is shutdown.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_notify_write_shutdown()
refsect2.para: Trigger a write-end-shutdown event. This should only be called by derived implementations.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO whose write-end is shutdown.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_notify_shutdown ()
refsect2.para: This function is called by an implementation when the read- and write- ends of the i/o object have both shut-down.

listitem.simpara: the object which is shut-down.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_notify_connected ()
refsect2.para: Trigger an is-connected event. This should only be called by derived implementations. Called to indicate that the connection has been made.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO that finished connecting to the remote side.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_is_polling_for_read()
refsect2.para: Check whether the last invocation of set_poll_read() indicated that polling for readability was desired.

listitem.simpara: the IO to query.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_is_polling_for_write()
refsect2.para: Check whether the last invocation of set_poll_write() indicated that polling for writability was desired.

listitem.simpara: the IO to query.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_get_is_connecting()
refsect2.para: Return whether the GskIO is still connecting. Will be FALSE if the GskIO is never connecting.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to test.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_get_is_readable()
refsect2.para: Return whether the GskIO is readable. (It means that the read-end is available-- it does not that there is any data which can be read.)

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to test.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_get_is_writable()
refsect2.para: Return whether the GskIO is writable. (It means that the write-end is available-- it does not mean that you can necessarily write data.)

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to test.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_get_never_partial_reads()
refsect2.para: Return whether the GskIO ever reads a partial buffer.
An example of a source which never returns partial data is a virtual source like /dev/zero.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to test.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_get_never_partial_writes()
refsect2.para: Return whether the GskIO ever writes a partial buffer.
An example of a source which never writes partial data is a infinite memory buffer, or a sink which merely discards data written to it.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to test.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_get_never_blocks_write()
refsect2.para: Return if the GskIO will never block to write data. It will always allow some data to be written, until it is full and will allow no more ever.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to test.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_get_never_blocks_read()
refsect2.para: Return if the GskIO will never block to read data. It will always return some data, until it is empty and will never return any more.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to test.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_get_idle_notify_write()
refsect2.para: Return whether the write-hook is in idle-notify mode. That means it will be triggered continually, as long as there is a unblocked hook watching it.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to test.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_get_idle_notify_read()
refsect2.para: Return whether the read-hook is in idle-notify mode. That means it will be triggered continually, as long as there is a unblocked hook watching it.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to test.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_get_is_open()
refsect2.para: Return whether the GskIO is open. A GskIO should be open if you want to use it.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to test.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_get_is_read_shutting_down()
refsect2.para: Get whether the read end of the IO is in the process of shutting down.

listitem.simpara: the IO to query.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_get_is_write_shutting_down()
refsect2.para: Get whether the write end of the IO is in the process of shutting down.

listitem.simpara: the IO to query.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_mark_is_connecting()
refsect2.para: Set the GskIO's is_connecting flag. This should only be called by the implementations of derived classes. By default, GskIO is not in the connecting state.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to affect.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_mark_is_readable()
refsect2.para: Set whether the GskIO is_readable. This should only be called by the implementations of derived classes. In general, you should not change is_readable more than once in the lifetime of an object; however some types of streams can be made readable again once they are shutdown.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to affect.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_mark_is_writable()
refsect2.para: Set whether the GskIO is_writable. This should only be called by the implementations of derived classes. In general, you should not change is_writable more than once in the lifetime of an object; however some types of streams can be made writable again once they are shutdown.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to affect.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_mark_never_partial_reads()
refsect2.para: Mark the never_partial_reads flag. This means that the read method should never have a partial success. This should therefore only be used by implementations of derived classes.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to affect.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_mark_never_partial_writes()
refsect2.para: Mark the never_partial_writes flag. This means that the write method should never have a partial success. This should therefore only be used by implementations of derived classes.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to affect.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_mark_never_blocks_write()
refsect2.para: Indicate that writing to the GskIO never will block. Once this flag is set it cannot be cleared. This should only be used by implementations of derived classes.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to affect.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_mark_never_blocks_read()
refsect2.para: Indicate that reading from the GskIO never will block. Once this flag is set it cannot be cleared. This should only be used by implementations of derived classes.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to affect.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_mark_idle_notify_write()
refsect2.para: Tell the GskIO system to continually trigger a user's write hook, if any, assuming it is not blocked. This should only be used by implementations of derived classes.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to affect.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_mark_idle_notify_read()
refsect2.para: Tell the GskIO system to continually trigger a user's read hook, if any, assuming it is not blocked. This should only be used by implementations of derived classes.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to affect.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_mark_is_open()
refsect2.para: Indicate that a GskIO is open. This should only be used by implementations of derived classes.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to affect.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_mark_shutdown_on_error()
refsect2.para: Cause the GskIO object to be shutdown if it fails.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO object to affect.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_clear_is_readable()
refsect2.para: Indicate that a GskIO is no longer readable. In most classes, this condition is permanent. This should only be used by implementations of derived classes.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to affect.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_clear_is_writable()
refsect2.para: Indicate that a GskIO is no longer writable. In most classes, this condition is permanent. This should only be used by implementations of derived classes.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to affect.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_clear_never_partial_reads()
refsect2.para: Indicate that the GskIO may exhibit partial reads.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to affect.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_clear_never_partial_writes()
refsect2.para: Indicate that the GskIO may exhibit partial writes.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to affect.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_clear_idle_notify_write()
refsect2.para: Stop continually triggering the user's write hook. (This undoes gsk_io_mark_idle_notify_write())

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to affect.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_clear_idle_notify_read()
refsect2.para: Stop continually triggering the user's read hook. (This undoes gsk_io_mark_idle_notify_read())

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to affect.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_clear_is_open()
refsect2.para: Indicate that the GskIO is closed.

listitem.simpara: the GskIO to affect.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_clear_shutdown_on_error()
refsect2.para: Suppress automatic-shutdown when the stream fails.

listitem.simpara: the stream to affect.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_set_idle_notify_write()
refsect2.para: Set whether to perform idle-notification on the writable end of this GskIO.

listitem.simpara: the IO object to affect.
whether to notify.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_set_idle_notify_read()
refsect2.para: Set whether to perform idle-notification on the readable end of this GskIO.

listitem.simpara: the IO object to affect.
whether to notify.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_set_error ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gsk_io_set_error (GskIO *io, GskIOErrorCause cause, GskErrorCode error_code, const char *format, ...);
refsect2.para: Set the error member of the GskIO.

listitem.simpara: the object whose GError member should be set.
what kind of situation triggered the error
an error code.
a printf-like format string.
values to be embedded in the format string.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_set_gerror ()
refsect2.para: Set the IO's error member, taking ownership of the error parameter.

listitem.simpara: the IO whose error member should be set.
the operation which caused the error.
gerror which will be freed by the IO automatically now.

refsect2.title: gsk_io_error_cause_to_string ()
refsect2.para: Convert the GskIOErrorCause code into a human-readable lowercase string.

listitem.simpara: the cause code.
the error as a string.

refsect2.title: The "on-connect" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GskIO *gskio, gpointer user_data) : No Recursion
refsect2.para: Signal to indicate that the gsk-io has become connected (to a remote server).

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "on-error" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GskIO *gskio, gpointer user_data) : No Recursion
refsect2.para: Signal to indicate that the gsk-io has had an error. Use the 'error' and 'error_cause' members of GskIO to find out what went wrong.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
